treatment.reference: Bergey’s Manal vol 1. pg 286 and Table A2.22. Generic description on page 283.
treatment.description: Irregular cocci, 1.0-1.5 µm in diameter, occurring individually or in aggregates. Gram-negative. Nonmotile. Sensitive to lysis by detergents. Cells grow with catabolic substrate plus either vitamins or peptones as sole organic additions to the medium, but yeast extract stimulates growth. The mol% G+C is 40.9. Able to grow on methyl sulfides. Stimulated by biotin and thiamine. Able to grow between pH pH 8 and 9. Able to grow between 0.3-1.0 M NaCl. Enriched and isolated from a slurry of subsurface solids from a saline, alkaline aquifer. Able to grow between 30-40˚C. Catabolic substrates are methanol, methylamines, methanol, and methyl sulfides. No growth on H2/CO2, formate, acetate, or alcohols other than methanol. Tungstate is required.
